headline: Democrats Gubernatorial debate
sentences: Former Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley and former Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley will make their cases to the voters on Tuesday at 7 p.m. from Central State University.
Cranley served as Cincinnati Mayor for 13 years and has made Ohio's infrastructure and economy the focus of his platform.
Whaley spent eight years as Mayor of Dayton and is pushing similar issues centered on pandemic recovery.
Two former mayors running to be the Democratic nominee for governor are preparing for a debate tonight.
